results.title: Les Mauvais Coups = Naked Autumn
results.brief_description:
A former car racing champion, Milan, decides to retire in the country with his wife to write a book of memoirs. Roberte knows that their relationship has run its course and she thinks she is going to ‘help’ things by throwing a young schoolteacher in her husband’s arms.

Credits: Producer, Jean Thuillier ; director, Francois Leterrier ; writers Francois Leterrier, Roger Vailland ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Maurice Le Roux.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Reginald Kernan, Alexandra Stewart, Jose-Luis de Villalonga, Marcel Pagliero.

results.title: Les Maries de L'an II
results.brief_description:
A few year before the French Revolution, Nicolas kills one of his wife’s lover and must flee to America in order to avoid police prosecution. While in exile he becomes a successful spice merchant. Soon Nicolas is engaged to be married to a wealthy heiress. However, he must return to France, by now in the throes of the revolution, to obtain divorce from his wife and

Credits: Producer, Alain Poire ; director, Jean-Paul Rappeneau ; writers, Daniel Boulanger, Maurice Clavel, Claude Sautet, Jean-Paul Rappeneau ; photography, Claude Renoir ; music, Michel Legrand ; art direction, Willy Holt, Alexandre Trauner.
Cast: Jean-Paul Belmondo, Marlene Jobert, Michel Auclair, Laura Antonelli, Sami Frey, Denise Peron, Julien Guiomar, Charles Denner, Pierre Brasseur, Mario David.

results.title: Les Maitres du Temps = the Time Masters
results.creator_credit: Rene Laloux, Jacques Dercourt and Roland Gritti
results.brief_description:
His name is Piel. He is four years old. He is the last survivor of planet Perdide. How could he outsmart the dangers of a planet that has already claimed the lives of his parents and recognise the poisonous fruits and the venimous flowers? His last link with the world of humans is a radio transmitter whose distress signals have been received by Grand Max, a traveller with a generous heart. Max uses the radio to keep watch on the orphan while trying to organise a rescue mission. Stephan Wul (born 1922) is one of the pioneers of French science-fiction writing. Jean Giraud, by the name of Moebius, revolutionised the universe of fictional comics, creating a special and magical atmosphere around his stories. He is credited with inspiring the visual imagery of works such as ‘Blade Runner’ and ‘The Fifth Element’. Further reading: Gianalberto Bendazzi. ‘Rene Laloux. Drawings That Move’. Animation World: April 1996 (Vol. 1, No.1). Online. http://www.awn.com/mag/issue1.1/

Credits: Producers, Roland Gritti, Jacques Dercourt ; director, Rene Laloux ; writers, Rene Laloux, Moebius (Jean Giraud), Jean-Patrick Manchette ; photography, Mihaly Kovacs, Andras Klausz, Zoltan Basco, Arpad Lossonczy ; music, Jean-Pierre Bourtayre
Cast: Sady Rebbot, Frederic Legros, Jean Valmont, Yves Marie, Pierre Tourneur, Alain Cuny [voices only].

results.title: Les Liaisons Dangereuses
results.creator_credit: Roger Vadim, Leopold Schlossberg, Astor Productions and Films Marceau
results.brief_description: Roger Vadim up-dates Choderlos de Laclos’ 18th century novel to present day France. Valmont (Gerard Philipe) and Juliette (Jeanne Moreau) turn love and sex into a game, and in doing so make victims of those who fall for their seductive manipulations. However in their attempt to corrupt the innocent Marianne, love threatens to destroy all the players of the game. The cast also includes Jean-Louis Trintignant. The jazz score is by Thelonious Monk and the excellent photography is by Marcel Grignon.

results.title: Les Honneurs de la Guerre = the Honours of War
results.brief_description:
Nanteuil, 1944. The joy of the impending liberation is stopped by the arrival of a group of German soldiers. They have no murderous intent, in spite of the exhortations of one of their officers. They just want to make a deal: they will lock the population in the church and wait for the arrival of the US army to whom they want to surrender without fighting. During the wait in the church, the tension between the villagers rises, slowly entertained by a French fascist, to the point where bloodshed seems inevitable. For attempting to break the traditional image of the Resistance, this film was held on the shelves for two years and released only in February 1962

Credits: Producer, Daniel Muller ; director, Jean Dewever ; writer, Jean-Charles Tacchella ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet.
Cast: Pierre Collet, Paul Mercey, Henri Maik, Danielle Godet, Alix Mahieux, Bernard Verley.

results.title: Les Hommes et la Mer (Ep.7)
results.brief_description:
A wide ranging episode covering the expansion of commercial (over) fishing of seals, whales, cod fish as well as other issues pertaining to marine protection: oil pollution, environmental activism (Greenpeace). Other issues include: survival at sea (Dr. Bombard) and yacht racing (eric Tabarly, Chichester, A. Colas, A. Gerbaud).

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: Les Grenouilles
results.brief_description: Les Grenouilles is a musical telling of the familiar love triangle scenario. All action takes place on ice skates and all dialogue is delivered in song. The film is a stop motion clay animation work and the Director’s tribute to all the Doris Day films ever made.

results.title: Les Granges Brulees = the Burned Barns
results.brief_description:
A crime has been committed near an isolated farm called ‘Les Granges Brulees’, in the mountains of Jura. The farm is owned by Rose, the pillar on which her family depend and against which it pulls. Judge Larcher is in charge of the investigation and every piece of evidence points towards Rose’s youngest son. As the investigation progresses, Larcher becomes drawn into the secrets of Rose’s clan, digging up painful truths about each member of this apparently closely knit family.

Credits: Producer, Ralph Baum ; director, Jean Chapot ; writers, Jean Chapot, Sebastien Roulet ; photography, Sacha Vierny ; music, Jean-Michel Jarre.
Cast: Alain Delon, Simone Signoret, Paul Crauchet, Bernard Le Coq, Miou-Miou, Renato Salvatori, Jean Bouise, Christian Barbier, Fernand Ledoux.

results.title: Les Grandes Manoeuvres
results.creator_credit: Rene Clair, Rizzoli Film and Filmsonor
results.brief_description: Armand de la Vennes prides himself as the Don Juan of his cavalry regiment. To prove his reputation he accepts a bet that he can win any woman in the town chosen by his fellows, in the month before the regiment leaves for summer manoeuvres. Marie-Louise (Michele Morgan), beautiful divorcee and new arrival in town, is selected as his target. What starts out as a lighthearted wager turns into serious drama as Armand tries vainly to overturn his reputation and prove himself to be loving, faithful and honest. Stars Brigitte Bardot and Gerard Philipe.
